page.title: 17THE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The local shop is opposite Heversham Church. It is run by Mr. and Mrs. Shuttleworth. They have lived there for 23 years and run a post office which has been open for five and a half years. The shop averages 70 - l00 customers every day. They like living in the area and like the customers very much. The building is 200 years old and today it is fitted out as a general grocery store which goes a long way to meet the needs of the local population. They keep a wide range of stock which includes not only frozen and fresh food stuff but general stock ranging from greetings cards to items of hardware. They sell sweets and tobacco, have daily deliveries of fresh bread and milk and with the shop being in the centre of the village, it provides notices of general interest and acts as a centre
